definition: lit. like a turtle in a jar/to be trapped (idiom)
pottery container for water, wine etc
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: We bottled the enemy up like turtles in a jar.
sentences.chinese: 我們把敵人圍困得象甕中之鱉。

sentences.english: Radicals of the Yellow Scarves Rebellion were packed together like turtles in a jar and appeared to be in great disarray.
sentences.chinese: 眼看宛城被圍，黃巾軍如甕中之鱉一樣，軍心大亂。
